contentheadline.headline: You've Got to Believe in Something

contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = You've Got to Believe in Something | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Spin Doctors]] | Cover = Spin_Doctors_-_You've_Got_to_Believe_in_Something.jpg | Border = yes | Released = May 14, 1996 | Recorded = 1995 & 1996 | Genre = [[Pop music|Pop]]/[[Rock music|Rock]] | Length = | Label = [[Epic Records|Epic]] | Producer = [[Peter Denenberg]],<br />[[Danny "Kootch" Kortchmar]] | Last album = ''[[Turn It Upside Down]]''<br />(1994) | This album = '''''You've Got to Believe in Something'''''<br />(1996) | Next album = ''[[Here Comes the Bride (album)|Here Comes the Bride]]''<br />(1999) }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|2.5|5}} <ref>{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r233032|first=Stephen Thomas|last=Erlewine}}</ref> | rev2 = ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' | rev2Score = C+ <ref>[http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,292575,00.html ''Entertainment Weekly'' review]</ref> | rev3 = ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' | rev3Score = {{Rating|2|5}} <ref>[http://web.archive.org/web/20071002111045/http://www.rollingstone.com/artists/spindoctors/albums/album/237918/review/5945129/youve_got_to_believe_in_something ''Rolling Stone'' review]</ref> }} '''''You've Got to Believe in Something''''' is the third studio [[album]] by American [[jam band]] [[Spin Doctors]], released in 1996. ==Track listing== {{Track listing | total_length = | all_writing = Chriss Barron, Aaron Comess, Anthony Krizan, Mark White except as noted | writing_credits = yes | title1 = You've Got to Believe in Something | length1 = 4:02 | title2 = House | writer2 = Barron, Comess, Eric Schenkman, White | length2 = 3:53 | title3 = Dogs on a Doe | length3 = 5:12 | title4 = I Can't Believe You're Still With Her | length4 = 3:44 | title5 = She Used to Be Mine | writer5 = Barron, Comess, Krizan, White, Lewilda Kiner Jr. | length5 = 3:35 | title6 = She's Not You | length6 = 5:06 | title7 = To Make Me Blue | length7 = 3:33 | title8 = 'bout a Train | writer8 = Barron, Comess | length8 = 5:25 | title9 = Where Angels Fear to Tread | length9 = 4:02 | title10 = If Wishes Were Horses | length10 = 4:29 | title11 = Sister Sisyphus | writer11 = Barron, Comess, White, Christopher Gross, Arnie Lawrence, Jason Richardson | length11 = 4:06 | title12 = [[That's the Way (I Like It)]] | writer12 = Harry W. Casey, Richard Finch | note12 = Unlisted Bonus Track) (featuring [[Biz Markie]] | length12 = 5:27 }} Immediately following the bonus track, a brief passage from "I Can't Believe You're Still With Her" is played over and over on a [[kazoo]] as [[Tommy Chong]] objects. ==Members== *Chris Barron - [[Singing|vocals]] *Aaron Comess - [[percussion instrument|percussion]], [[Drum kit|drums]] *Anthony Krizan - [[guitar]], vocals *Mark White - [[bass guitar|bass]] ==Additional Musicians== *Kevin Bents - [[keyboard instrument|keyboards]] *[[Biz Markie]] - vocals *John Bush - [[conga]] *[[Tommy Chong]] - [[kazoo]] *Robin Clarke - background vocals *Babi Floyd - background vocals *Frank Floyd - background vocals *Diva Gray - background vocals *Frankie La Rocka - shaker, egg shaker *Arnie Lawrence - [[saxophone]] *Tyra White - bass *Bernie Worrell - keyboards ==Production== *Producers: Peter Denenberg, Danny "Kootch" Kortchmar *Engineer: Peter Denenberg *Assistant engineers: Derrick Garrett, Thom Leinbach, Robert L. Smith, Jr. *Mastering: Ted Jensen *Photography: Paul LaRaia ==Charts== '''Singles''' {| border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=2 width="60%" !align="left"|Year !align="left"|Single !align="left"|Chart !align="left"|Position |- |align="left"|1996 |align="left"|"She Used To Be Mine" |align="left"|UK Singles Chart |align="left"|55 |- |} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Spin Doctors}} [[Category:Spin Doctors albums]] [[Category:1996 albums]] [[Category:Epic Records albums]]
